titleStmt.title: Loves unspeakable passion: or, The youngman's answer to tender hearts of London city. Beauty over love doth triumph, causing lovers to complain; but 'tis pitty, one so pritty, should be filled with disdain; to a pleasant new play-house tune. Or, Tender hearts, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon at the sign of the] Angel, in Guil-spur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "How can I conceal my passion ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the sign of the] Angel, in Guil-spur-street.
